definition: (like) a cat on a hot tin roof/anxious/agitated
pinyin: re4 guo1 shang5 de5 ma3 yi3

definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

sentences.english: Failing to find her homework, Jill is just like a cat on a hot tin roof.
sentences.chinese: 吉爾的作業找不到了，急得像熱鍋上的螞蟻。

sentences.english: He looked like a cat on hot bricks.
sentences.chinese: 他急得像熱鍋上的螞蟻。

sentences.english: Ailey nasty like on hot pot ant, in office mad.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉急得如熱鍋上的螞蟻，在辦公室發瘋。

sentences.english: He is as nervous as a cat on a hot roof.
sentences.chinese: 他緊張的像一隻熱鍋上的螞蟻。

sentences.english: He was so worried that he looked like a cat on hot bricks.
sentences.chinese: 他焦急如焚，就象熱鍋上的螞蟻。

sentences.english: What's wrong with you? You look like a cat on hot bricks.
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼了？你看上去就像是熱鍋上的螞蟻。

sentences.english: He was like a cat in hot bricks before his driving test.
sentences.chinese: 在他考駕駛考試前他就像熱鍋上的螞蟻那樣緊張。
